nav.div: Xenia Community Schools » ABOUT US » Latest News » XCS Plans to Close for Three Weeks

div.h3: XCS Plans to Close for Three Weeks

br.span: By directive of the State of Ohio,
br.strong: Xenia Community Schools will close for three weeks beginning Monday, March 16.

br.span: Here is what you should know:

span.style: font-size: small; line-height: 106%; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; font-family: "Century Gothic", sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41);

br.span: Closing schools means that students will not report to buildings beginning Monday, March 16.

span.style: font-size: small; line-height: 106%; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; font-family: "Century Gothic", sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41);

br.span: XCS currently expects the closure to run through Friday, April 3.

span.style: font-size: small; line-height: 106%; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; font-family: "Century Gothic", sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41);

br.span:
All after-hours activities, including sports and other extra-curricular activities will be discontinued as of the end of the school day on Friday, March 13. Activities will not resume until school is back in session, and buildings are closed to non-essential personnel.
▪ Effective Tuesday, March 17, the XCS Central Office will be closed to the public.

strong.span:
Note that resources and learning links have been moved to separate pages:
K-5 Students
Students in Grades 6-12

div.script:
$(document).ready(function () {
        var logConsole = function (str) {
            console.log(str);
        };
        if ($('#tabPortlet_280313 .divTabEdit').val() == "True") {
            var isModern = ('True');
            if(isModern.toLowerCase() == "true")
            {
                var tabObj = $('#tabPortlet_280313 ');
                var tabM = $('#ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs').attr('portlet') == 'tab';

                function activate() {
                    $(tabObj).scrollingTabs({                 
                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_0","title":"FAQs","content":"School Closure FAQs for XCS Families
\n
\nNote that these FAQs include the most current information we have to share. Please check back often for updates. (FAQs posted 3/25/20, unless an update is noted)
\n
\n​Looking for information for elementary school families? Visit the K-5 information page for additional FAQs.
\n
\n1. Will students return to school this year?
\nWe are continuing to plan for a variety of contingencies. The closure of schools was extended by Governor DeWine through Friday, May 1, with plans to reassess the situation at that point. As soon as we have additional information, we will inform families. Update: 3/30/20 
\n 
\n2. What about events, programs, and activities on the calendar?
\nWe understand that students and families are anxious to hear about changes for major events and activities on the calendar in the coming weeks and months. At this time, there is no final plan for any of these dates, but we will advise families as soon as new information is available. 
\n 
\n3. What about State Testing?
\nPer House Bill 197, which was approved by both houses on March 25, 2020 and is expected to be signed into law by Gov. DeWine, testing for the 2019-2020 school year has been waived. The same bill also included waivers to allow “distance learning” days to be used to make up days missed due to Coronavirus, and includes provisions for graduation for students who were on track to graduate this year. 
\n 
\nWhile the full impact of the law is not yet known, it addresses many of the technical and logistical issues affecting our school system. Read more.
\n 
\n4. My family is in need of resources or help. Who can I contact?
\nGrab-and-Go food pick-up is still available Monday through Friday from 10-11 a.m. at Arrowood, Cox, McKinley, and Shawnee Elementary Schools for ANY child (ages 1-18). Plans are for the meal service to continue through the extension of the Stay at Home order (through at least May 1). Families can reach out to their building counselors for information about resources, and families can also contact Kathy Napier, the district’s McKinney-Vento program liaison via email. Update: 3/31/20 
\n
\nFind your counselor’s contact information:
\n\n
 Elementary Counselors 
\n Warner Middle School Counselors 
\n XHS Counselors \n5. When will I receive my child's report card? 
\nDue to the current Stay at Home order for the state, we do not anticipate printing or mailing report cards to families at this time. Parents can always access their child's progress online through ProgressBook. 
\n 
\n6. How do I receive information from the school? 
\n Sign up to receive One Call Now updates via phone. You can do this by reaching out to your building secretary via email. 
\n Opt in to newsletters from Dr. Lofton during this COVID-19 crisis. 
\n Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter
\n\n
","active":true,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_1","title":"THE PLAN","content":"THE PLAN
\n
\n\nThe district will implement the at-home learning plans that were to be tested as part of an upcoming District Safety Exercise, as follows: 
\n
\nWeek #1 – March 16-20
\n▪ Students in grades K-5 will be given Home Learning Kits with lessons for the week on Friday, March 13 at the end of the day. 
\n▪ Students in grades 6-12 will complete online learning via Google Classroom, where teachers will assign lessons and students can submit work, as if they were still in the building. 
\n\n   ▪ Students having trouble accessing their online classroom can review directions, or ask for help through an online form.
\n\n   ▪ The first online lessons will be posted by the end of the day on Monday, March 16.
\n
\nWeek #2 – March 23-27 – SPRING BREAK
\n
\nWeek #3 – March 30-April 3
\n\nCurrent plans are to repeat the process from week #1, with information to come on how families can pick up new Home Learning Kits for that week and/or work with their student(s) at home to continue learning. 
\n
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_2","title":"SCHOOL LUNCH PROGRAM","content":"SCHOOL LUNCH PROGRAM 
\n
\n*UPDATE 3/31/20* 
\nXCS plans to continue the Grab-and-Go Meals for any child (ages 1-18) through the coming weeks of extended school closure.
\n
\n--
\n
\n*UPDATE 3/25/20* 
\nGrab-and-Go Meal Pickup is now available to ANY child, ages 1-18.
\n
\n--
\n
\n\nFor students who depend on XCS for breakfast and lunch, a grab-and-go option will be available for the duration of the three week closure, including the Spring Break week. 
\n
\nAny XCS student can pick up a single food package each day, Monday-Friday between 10:00-11:00 a.m., that will include breakfast and lunch items. Food pick-ups will be available at the following school locations: Arrowood Elementary, Cox Elementary, McKinley Elementary, and Shawnee Elementary. 
\n
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_3","title":"RESOURCES BY GRADE","content":"GRADES K-5
\n
\nVisit the Elementary Update Page for more information and updated learning links.
\n
\n\n
\n\nGRADES 6-12
\n
\nVisit the Update Page for Grades 6-12 for more information and updated learning links.
","active":false,"disabled":false}],// required,
                        propPaneId: 'paneId', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propTitle: 'title', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propActive: 'active', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes

                        tabMode : tabM,
                        scrollToTabEdge: false, // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        disableScrollArrowsOnFullyScrolled: false // optional- pass in default value for demo purposes
                    }).on('ready.scrtabs', function() {
                        $('#'+this.id+' .tab-pane').attr('tabindex',0);
                    });
                };

                activate();
            }
        }
    });

br.span: The district reminds families that this is a completely new process, and that changes may occur as it unfolds. Information will be shared as it is available directly with families via email, here on this page, and through Xenia Community Schools social media accounts.
In particular, XCS families should look for weekly reminder emails with any updates about this plan via the Superintendent’s e-news.

div.span: Not getting our emails? Be sure to opt in to our Superintendent's News.

div.div: 819 Colorado Drive, Xenia, OH 45385 | Phone (937) 376-2961 | Fax (937) 372-4701
